Bedrock remains unbreakable even upon impact, but shards can be chipped off from it. These shards, while not useful on their own, can be repurposed for creating a formidable reinforced shield.

Another possibility is to add an option to see an icon on the screen indicating the direction (& color, if possible/reasonable) of a beacon beam. This would make beacons helpful as, well, beacons (which in the real world, served as a way to find someplace) and is deserved because of how late-game they are. (This would be the similar to lodestones, but better in every way.)

Other interesting things would be if they could be named, or have a map icon.
Definitely sounds interesting. Should they be customizable? Like, they can wear a vest, or a fez.
no
I WANT MONKEYS
Bravo e una balla idea
They're likely to be exclusive to ocean ruins to add an incentive for them (and perhaps specific lore), rather than any old structure.
Nice! I hope they add digsites that you can find sniffer eggs and sus-sand at.

YES!  I haven't found a single sniffer egg since they were added.  I've even used a website that tells you where biomes and ruins are and all I find in suspicious sand is useless stuff like coal, gold nuggets, even wheat, but no sniffer eggs!  I don't mind having to work for something but it's kind of pointless for not a GREAT reward.

Yes! I've been wanting this so badly. Along with just a little bit more weather. Like cloudy weather, where the sky becomes cloudy and mobs will take longer to star getting burned. Seasons should come in 3 sub seasons, basically like months, that will last maybe 5-10 days (But can be configured). The leaves will change with the seasons. Thunderstorms will be more common in late spring and throughout summer. Weather can be localized instead of server-wide. Temperature will play more of a role. Temperature can vary day by day within the parameters of each sub-season, with mid winter being the coldest, and mid summer being the hottest. Perhaps you could drink a water bottle, swim in water, or stay in the shade to cool off when it's too hot. Excessive heat can cause slowness and even gradual health loss over time. You can warm up in the cold by being near a fire (including campfires and furnaces), wearing leather armor, or maybe even crafting coats with wool. Cold can cause hunger and slowness, with gradual health loss as well. And sunrise and sunset could be at different times. Speaking of sunrises, at the end of the day, I would just love to see seasons and a little more variable weather in Minecraft, however they decide to do it. I really hope this gets added sometime.
That's a huge process. I'd prefer static seasonal biomes instead.
Sick Idea
If they actually are particle, then I'd like them to be attached to a block so I can use them in other biome builds too.
That is an absolutely amazing thought keep up the good work

The MAtmos mod was my #1 must-have mod for Minecraft years ago. I would wholeheartedly support ambient sounds in vanilla minecraft. I'm actually surprised they were never added along the way, it makes such a difference.

I'd suggest the wood color for tree ferns should be green, just because that's pretty much the only primary color not yet represented by a wood set. Sequoia trees would be alright to use the same kind of wood as Spruce I think.

Perhaps the Sniffer could dig up fern tree saplings after being given a fern by the player, and sequoia saplings after being given a spruce sapling.

Sequoia uses a wood color already used by mangrove, so it likely won't be added, think of ginkgo trees, maybe ginkgo wood could be a welcome edition, not sure on the color as the color would have to be close to something already existing but the tree fern has potential because of the unique color that people want azalea to use, bamboo doesn't count since that's lime green.
The idea is great, but the villages are definitely not disturbed.
Nice idea
Maybe have slimeballs be used as a way to hydrate the mob
You can also weave ropes from the bark, this should be added. Apart from this, there is also bone armor, felt armor, copper armor, even paper and bamboo armor.

I think this is a creative idea but since wood is an easily obtained item, Mojang won't make the armour very protective-even worse than leather. It could be useful for players to survive the first night but I think the armour will be discarded once players find iron- if they even choose to make it. Also, the durability may not be too high and It could just seem like a waste as it would probably be underused as iron is fairly common as well. Still cool idea and it would be nice if a mod had bark armour!
This can also be used as camouflage.
